title: Input
description: A customizable and theme-aware input component with built-in support for variants, sizes, loading states, and error handling.

# Input Component Documentation The **Input** component is a fully customizable text input field that supports multiple variants, sizes, and states. It's ideal for form elements in modern, theme-aware applications. ## Preview and Code Snippet Preview Code
```tsx import React from 'react'; import { Input } from '@/components/input'; export default function Example() { return (
); } ``` ## Props | Prop | Type | Default | Description | |-------------|----------------------------------------------------|--------------|-----------------------------------------------------------------------------| | `variant` | `'outline' \| 'filled' \| 'none'` | `'outline'` | Controls the input's background and border style. | | `size` | `'xs' \| 'sm' \| 'md' \| 'lg' \| 'xl'` | `'sm'` | Controls the height and padding of the input. | | `fullWidth` | `boolean` | `false` | If true, the input takes up full width of its container. | | `isError` | `boolean` | `false` | Applies red border and ring to indicate error state. | | `isLoading` | `boolean` | `false` | Displays a spinning loader icon inside the input on the right. | | `...props` | `React.InputHTMLAttributes` | â€“ | Inherits all native input attributes. | ## Styling This input uses Tailwind CSS and `class-variance-authority` to manage style variants, making it easy to scale with design tokens or theming systems. ## Accessibility Ensure to associate `
